cara.tests.test_full_algorithm module

class SimpleConcentrationModel(infected_presence: cara.models.Interval, viral_load: Union[float, numpy.ndarray], breathing_rate: Union[float, numpy.ndarray], room_volume: Union[float, numpy.ndarray], lambda_ventilation: Union[float, numpy.ndarray], BLO_factors: Tuple[float, float, float], num_infected: int = 1, humidity: float = 0.3, diameter_min: float = 0.1, diameter_max: float = 30.0, evaporation: float = 0.3, cn: Tuple[float, float, float] = (0.06, 0.2, 0.0010008), mu: Tuple[float, float, float] = (0.989541, 1.38629, 4.97673), sigma: Tuple[float, float, float] = (0.262364, 0.506818, 0.585005))

Bases: object

Simple model for the background (long-range) concentration, without all the flexibility of cara.models.ConcentrationModel. For independent, end-to-end testing purposes. This assumes no mask wearing, and the same ventilation rate at all times.

BLO_factors: Tuple[float, float, float]

BLO factors

Np(diameter: float, BLO_factors: Tuple[float, float, float]) → float

number of emitted particles per unit volume (BLO model) in cm^-3.ln(micron)^-1

aerosol_volume(diameter: float) → float

particle volume in microns^3

breathing_rate: Union[float, numpy.ndarray]

breathing rate (m^3/h)

cn: Tuple[float, float, float] = (0.06, 0.2, 0.0010008)
concentration(t: float) → Union[float, numpy.ndarray]

concentration at a given time t

deposition_removal_coefficient() → float

coefficient in front of gravitational deposition rate, in h^-1.microns^-2 Note: 0.4512 = 1.88e-4 * 3600 / 1.5

diameter_max: float = 30.0

maximum particle diameter considered (microns)

diameter_min: float = 0.1

minimum particle diameter considered (microns)

evaporation: float = 0.3

evaporation factor

f(removal_rate: Union[float, numpy.ndarray], deltat: float) → Union[float, numpy.ndarray]

A general function to compute the main integral over diameters

humidity: float = 0.3

relative humidity RH

infected_presence: cara.models.Interval

infected people presence interval

lambda_ventilation: Union[float, numpy.ndarray]

ventilation rate (air changes per hour) - including HEPA

mu: Tuple[float, float, float] = (0.989541, 1.38629, 4.97673)
num_infected: int = 1

number of infected people

removal_rate() → Union[float, numpy.ndarray]

removal rate lambda in h^-1, excluding the deposition rate.

room_volume: Union[float, numpy.ndarray]

room volume (m^3)

sigma: Tuple[float, float, float] = (0.262364, 0.506818, 0.585005)
vR(diameter: float) → float

emission rate per unit diameter, in RNA copies / h / micron

viral_load: Union[float, numpy.ndarray]

viral load (RNA copies / mL)

class SimpleExposureModel(infected_presence: cara.models.Interval, viral_load: Union[float, numpy.ndarray], breathing_rate: Union[float, numpy.ndarray], room_volume: Union[float, numpy.ndarray], lambda_ventilation: Union[float, numpy.ndarray], BLO_factors: Tuple[float, float, float], num_infected: int = 1, humidity: float = 0.3, diameter_min: float = 0.1, diameter_max: float = 30.0, evaporation: float = 0.3, cn: Tuple[float, float, float] = (0.06, 0.2, 0.0010008), mu: Tuple[float, float, float] = (0.989541, 1.38629, 4.97673), sigma: Tuple[float, float, float] = (0.262364, 0.506818, 0.585005), finf: Union[float, numpy.ndarray] = 0.5, HI: Union[float, numpy.ndarray] = 0.0, ID50: Union[float, numpy.ndarray] = 50.0, transmissibility: Union[float, numpy.ndarray] = 1.0, sr_models: Tuple[cara.tests.test_full_algorithm.SimpleShortRangeModel, ...] = ())

Bases: cara.tests.test_full_algorithm.SimpleConcentrationModel

Simple model for the background (long-range) exposure, without all the flexibility of cara.models.ExposureModel. For independent, end-to-end testing purposes. This assumes no mask wearing, identical inhalation and exhalation breathing rate, indentical presence for the infected and the exposed people, the same ventilation rate at all times, and all short-range interaction intervals are within presence intervals of the infected.

F(removal_rate: Union[float, numpy.ndarray], deltat: float, evaporation: float) → Union[float, numpy.ndarray]

A general function to compute the main integral over diameters

HI: Union[float, numpy.ndarray] = 0.0

host immunity factor (0. for not immune)

ID50: Union[float, numpy.ndarray] = 50.0

infectious dose (ID50)

dose() → Union[float, numpy.ndarray]

total deposited dose (integrated over time and over particle diameters), including short and long range.

f_with_fdep(removal_rate: Union[float, numpy.ndarray], deltat: float, evaporation: float) → Union[float, numpy.ndarray]

Same as f but with fdep included in the integral.

fdep(diameter: float, evaporation: float) → float

fraction deposited

finf: Union[float, numpy.ndarray] = 0.5

fraction of infected viruses

integrated_background_concentration(t1: float, t2: float, evaporation: float) → Union[float, numpy.ndarray]

background (long-range) concentration integrated from t1 to t2 assuming both t1 and t2 are within a single presence interval. This includes the deposition fraction (fdep).

integrated_shortrange_concentration() → Union[float, numpy.ndarray]

short-range concentration integrated over interaction times and diameters. This includes the deposition fraction (fdep).

probability_infection()

total probability of infection

sr_models: Tuple[cara.tests.test_full_algorithm.SimpleShortRangeModel, ...] = ()

list of short-range interaction models

transmissibility: Union[float, numpy.ndarray] = 1.0
class SimpleShortRangeModel(interaction_interval: cara.models.SpecificInterval, distance: Union[float, numpy.ndarray] = 0.854, breathing_rate: Union[float, numpy.ndarray] = 0.51, BLO_factors: Tuple[float, float, float] = (1, 0, 0), diameter_min: float = 0.1, diameter_max: float = 100.0, D: float = 0.02, tstar: float = 2.0, Cr1: float = 0.18, Cx1: float = 2.4, Cr2: float = 0.2, Cx2: float = 2.2)

Bases: object

Simple model for the short-range concentration, without all the flexibility of cara.models.ShortRangeModel. For independent, end-to-end testing purposes. This assumes no mask wearing.

BLO_factors: Tuple[float, float, float] = (1, 0, 0)

tuple with BLO factors

Cr1: float = 0.18

Streamwise and radial penetration coefficients

Cr2: float = 0.2
Cx1: float = 2.4
Cx2: float = 2.2
D: float = 0.02

mouth opening diameter (m)

breathing_rate: Union[float, numpy.ndarray] = 0.51

breathing rate (m^3/h)

concentration(conc_model: cara.tests.test_full_algorithm.SimpleConcentrationModel, time: float) → Union[float, numpy.ndarray]

compute the short-range part of the concentration, and add it to the background concentration

diameter_max: float = 100.0

maximum diameter for integration (short-range only) (microns)

diameter_min: float = 0.1

minimum diameter for integration (short-range only) (microns)

dilution_factor() → Union[float, numpy.ndarray]

computes dilution factor at a certain distance x based on Wei JIA matlab script.

distance: Union[float, numpy.ndarray] = 0.854

tuple with interpersonal distanced from infected person (m)

interaction_interval: cara.models.SpecificInterval

time intervals in which a short-range interaction occurs

jet_concentration(conc_model: cara.tests.test_full_algorithm.SimpleConcentrationModel) → Union[float, numpy.ndarray]

virion concentration at the origin of the jet (close to the mouth of the infected person), in m^-3 we perform the integral of Np(d)*V(d) over diameter analytically

tstar: float = 2.0

duration of the expiration (s)

c_model() → cara.monte_carlo.models.ConcentrationModel
simple_c_model() → cara.tests.test_full_algorithm.SimpleConcentrationModel
simple_sr_models() → Tuple[cara.tests.test_full_algorithm.SimpleShortRangeModel, ...]
sr_models() → Tuple[cara.monte_carlo.models.ShortRangeModel, ...]

test_exposure_with_shortrange(c_model, sr_models, simple_sr_models)

cara.tests.test_monte_carlo_full_models module

bus_ride_mc()

Corresponds to the 5th line of Table 4 in https://doi.org/10.1101/2021.10.14.21264988, assuming viral is 5*10**8 instead of a LogCustomKernel distribution.

classroom_mc()

Corresponds to the 2nd line of Table 4 in https://doi.org/10.1101/2021.10.14.21264988

gym_mc()

Gym model for testing

shared_office_mc()

Corresponds to the 1st line of Table 4 in https://doi.org/10.1101/2021.10.14.21264988

skagit_chorale_mc()

Corresponds to the 4th line of Table 4 in https://doi.org/10.1101/2021.10.14.21264988, assuming viral is 10**9 instead of a LogCustomKernel distribution.

ski_cabin_mc()

Corresponds to the 3rd line of Table 4 in https://doi.org/10.1101/2021.10.14.21264988

cara.tests.test_predefined_distributions module
